intro: Dichaetanthera oblongifolia var. longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled dichaetanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant features elongated sepals that give it its varietal name, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
